New Records: Wanindu Hasaranga took 3 wickets and scored 10 runs with a strike rate of 333.33, setting a new record for the highest strike rate in a T20I match.
Sri Lanka achieved their highest ever score of 124 in a T20I innings.
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka won the match by 5 wickets with 18 balls remaining.
Pakistan's Mohammad Rizwan scored the fastest century (14 balls) in a T20I innings.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka elected to bat first after winning the toss.
Pakistan's bowlers struggled to contain Sri Lanka's batting order, particularly Pathum Nissanka who scored 55 runs.
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka's captain Dasun Shanaka praised Wanindu Hasaranga's all-round performance.
Pakistan's coach expressed frustration with their middle-order batting performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the 1764th T20I, marking a milestone for the format.
Dilshan Madushanka made his T20I debut for Sri Lanka.
Others: The match was held at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.
